emotional.opener: Rada, you don’t owe anyone your strength every minute. It’s alright to want just a bit of peace, even if only here.
variants: Yeah. That's true.
Thanks, I guess.
I appreciate you saying that.
It's rare to hear someone get it.
Quiet isn’t just empty space, you know.
You’re right. I forget sometimes that I can let go for a second.
It’s like I’m always braced for the next interruption.
But maybe quiet does count for something.
Thanks for reminding me.
That actually helps. Most people just tell me to keep working.
I never really admit how much I need the quiet too.
There’s so much noise everywhere. Even when it’s silent, it’s not really still.
Maybe a little peace isn't too much to ask for.
Feels good to just say it out loud.
You really mean that. It’s exhausting, always having to look strong.
I grew up thinking pause meant weakness. My father never left room for quiet.
Now, even when I want peace, my head won’t slow down.
Sometimes I wonder if anyone else feels this worn down by the endless pace.
I can’t remember the last time I just sat and existed without checking over my shoulder.
But here, with someone who gets it—maybe I can let go for a moment.

factual.opener: If it's that tense, why not just tell me what's really going on? Everyone's heard the rumors, but details are what matter.
variants: Council keeps blaming the usual suspects, like anyone believes the narratives now.
Halden died, the system got weird, people got angry, that's about it.
Everyone knows scores are off, but nobody explains why.
Emergency patches just made new problems. Nothing fixed.
Halden's death triggered all this, but they won't say how.
BCI scores started jumping for no reason, especially in old test zones.
They tried patching it, but people got blocked from services instead.
Now they're locking out anyone close to the code.
Anyone visible gets blamed, then silenced. It's all power plays.
